intro: Mariana eburnea, commonly known as the white sand tree, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its smooth, light-colored bark and large, heart-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. The tree is often found in moist, well-drained soils in lowland and mountainous areas.
